source: Major Bruce Middleton Hope Shand MC and bar ( 22 January 1917 -- 11 June 2006 ) was an officer in the British Army .
summary:
Bruce Middleton Hope Shand MC and bar (22 January 1917 – 11 June 2006) was a British Army officer who served in the Second World War. He was awarded the Military Cross twice, the first time for his actions in the Battle of France in 1940 and the second time for his actions in the Battle of Arnhem in 1944. After the war, he worked as a diplomat and businessman. He was the father of Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall.

Shand was born in London, England, on 22 January 1917. He was the son of Major General Sir Alexander Shand, 1st Baronet, and Lady Helen Hope. He was educated at Eton College and the Royal Military College, Sandhurst.

Shand was commissioned into the 1st Battalion, Scots Guards, in 1939. He served in the Battle of France in 1940, where he was awarded the Military Cross for his actions. He was captured by the Germans and held prisoner of war until 1945.

After the war, Shand worked as a diplomat and businessman. He was the British Ambassador to the Netherlands from 1967 to 1970. He was also the chairman of the British Steel Corporation from 1972 to 1975.

Shand married Rosalind Cubitt, daughter of the 2nd Marquess of Crewe, in 1946. They had three children, including Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall. Shand died on 11 June 2006 at the age of 89.

source: Make It or Break It . It was announced on April 26 , 2012 , that the series had ended and the third season would be the final season . The series finale aired on May 14 , 2012 .
summary:
Make It or Break It is an American teen drama television series created by Holly Sorensen that aired on ABC Family from December 8, 2009, to May 14, 2012. The series follows the lives of five young women at the California Dreams Gymnastics Academy as they train to become Olympic gymnasts. The series stars Aly Raisman, Kayla Rae Reid, Nia Sioux, Chelsea Hobbs, and Josie Loren.

The series was met with mixed reviews from critics, but it was a ratings success for ABC Family. The series was nominated for two Teen Choice Awards, and Raisman won the award for Choice TV Actress: Drama in 2010.

The series was canceled after three seasons. The final episode aired on May 14, 2012.

The series was set in the fictional town of San Diego, California. The California Dreams Gymnastics Academy was located in the town. The academy was owned and operated by Paul Kaplan (Neil Jackson). The academy was a prestigious gymnastics school that trained some of the best gymnasts in the country.

The five main characters in the series were Payson Keeler (Aly Raisman), Kaylie Cruz (Kayla Rae Reid), Lauren Tanner (Nia Sioux), Emily Kmetko (Chelsea Hobbs), and Chloe Kim (Josie Loren). Payson was the star gymnast at the academy. She was determined to win a gold medal at the Olympics. Kaylie was Payson's best friend. She was also a talented gymnast, but she was not as focused as Payson. Lauren was the new girl at the academy. She was a talented gymnast, but she was also very competitive. Emily was the youngest gymnast at the academy. She was a talented gymnast, but she was also very shy. Chloe was the newest gymnast at the academy. She was a talented gymnast, but she was also very rebellious.

The series followed the lives of the five girls as they trained for the Olympics. The girls faced many challenges, both on and off the gymnastics mat. They had to deal with injuries, competition, and personal problems. The girls also had to deal with the pressure of being in the public eye.

The series was a coming-of-age story about five young women who were trying to find their place in the world. The series was also about the power of friendship and the importance of family.

The series was a success for ABC Family. It was one of the network's highest-rated shows. The series was also popular with young viewers.

The series was canceled after three seasons. The final episode aired on May 14, 2012. The series was canceled due to low ratings.

source: Management body NHS Employers has given the plan the green light after advisers said there were a range of extra tasks they could do with more training. A Nuffield Trust review found examples of nurses filling in for hospital doctors and pharmacists for GPs. But unions warned against using it as a quick fix for problems in the NHS. It has been well documented that there are gaps in junior doctor rotas, while GPs are struggling to cope with the rising number of patients coming through their doors. NHS Employers asked the Nuffield Trust to look at ways the 1.3 million-strong workforce could be reshaped to help. The think tank highlighted examples of areas that were already experimenting. These included: The report said as well as helping cover for doctor shortages, such moves made sense because of the changing nature of care, with much more stress on looking after people with long-term conditions such as diabetes and heart disease rather than curing them. It said that as doctors only made up about one in 10 of the workforce much more was needed from other health staff, but the Nuffield Trust admitted money would need to be set aside to ensure it happened. Are nurses the new doctors? NHS short of front-line staff, MPs say Report author Candace Imison said there were "huge opportunities" in reshaping the workforce, in both improving patient care and providing staff with more rewarding roles. And NHS Employers chief executive Danny Mortimer said: "Our challenge now is to take forward the learning and recommendations in the report." But British Medical Association leader Dr Mark Porter said while he supported increasing the skills of the workforce, this should not be done "at the expense of good quality training for doctors or indeed doctors themselves". "It takes doctors many years to learn how to provide the best care for their patients, and there is no substitute for this kind of expertise and experience," he said. "There should be more staff support for doctors to help them coordinate the best possible care for their patients." And Unison head of health Christina McAnea said the squeeze on funding in the health service meant there was "all too often" no funding for training courses. "Developing the NHS support workforce must not be seen as a quick and cheap fix for the chronic shortages of nurses and other health workers across the country," she added. source: Mani Ratnam . Cited by the media as one of India 's influential filmmakers , Mani Ratnam is widely credited with revolutionising the Tamil film industry and altering the profile of Indian cinema .
summary:
Mani Ratnam is an Indian filmmaker who is widely credited with revolutionising the Tamil film industry and altering the profile of Indian cinema. He is known for his critically acclaimed films such as Roja, Bombay, Dil Se, and Guru. Ratnam's films are often characterised by their strong female characters, complex plots, and lavish visuals. He has won numerous awards for his work, including the National Film Award for Best Director and the Filmfare Award for Best Director.

Ratnam was born in Madurai, Tamil Nadu, India in 1952. He studied at the Film and Television Institute of India in Pune, where he made his first short film, Pallavi Anu Pallavi, in 1978. His first feature film, Roja, was released in 1992 and was a critical and commercial success. It was followed by a string of successful films, including Bombay (1995), Dil Se (1998), and Guru (2007).

Ratnam's films have been praised for their strong female characters, complex plots, and lavish visuals. He has been credited with revolutionising the Tamil film industry and altering the profile of Indian cinema. He has won numerous awards for his work, including the National Film Award for Best Director and the Filmfare Award for Best Director.

Ratnam is married to actress Suhasini Maniratnam. They have two children.

source: Many women have questioned the safety of the implants, which are used to treat incontinence, after suffering debilitating side effects. Two patients sitting on the original review group quit in protest at what they said was a watered-down report. Now independent expert Alison Britton, a professor of healthcare and medical law, will examine the final report. Ms Robison told Holyrood's public petitions committee that Prof Britton, from Glasgow Caledonian University, would examine the process by which the report came to its conclusions. She told MSPs: "Professor Britton will produce a report on how the independent review process was undertaken and importantly what lessons can be learned in the future." The report concluded procedures should not be offered routinely to women with pelvic organ prolapse. It recommended patients  be offered a range of treatments and given the information to make "informed choices". The report also said reporting of adverse events should be mandatory. Ms Robison confirmed the recommendations would continue to be implemented despite calls from campaigners for an all-out ban. The health secretary said the government did not have the power to ban the procedures as that lay with UK regulatory body the Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency. In other evidence, the chairwoman of the independent review Tracey Gillies apologised for failing to unite all panel members around the review's controversial final report. Ms Gillies took over as chairwoman of the independent review of transvaginal mesh implants in its final stages towards the end of last year. It emerged she had no conversations with previous chairwoman Lesley Wilkie, who resigned for personal reasons. Her evidence was punctuated by cries of "shame on you" and "rubbish" from a packed public gallery which included some women who had suffered painful and debilitating complications as a result of the procedure. Ms Gillies said her task had been "almost mission impossible from the beginning". She said: "It was clear that there were strongly-held views of difference at the point that I came in, so one could say more fool me for agreeing to chair this. "This is not something that most people would have ... welcomed would be the wrong word, but it's clearly going to be a very difficult thing and I personally have reflected and feel disappointed that I have not achieved what I would have set out to do, which would have been to bring this in in consensus. Olive McIlroy and Elaine Holmes - who had both suffered complications as a result of the surgery - quit the review group earlier this year, saying they felt "dismayed and disgusted" at the publication of the independent report. It was claimed that parts of the final report had been removed. Following their resignations, it emerged that a consultant also quit the expert group over concerns about the final draft of the report. Over the past 20 years, more than 20,000 women in Scotland have had mesh or tape implants but some have suffered painful and debilitating complications. There are more than 400 women currently taking legal action against Scottish health boards and manufacturers as a result of mesh implant surgery.
summary:
The independent review of transvaginal mesh implants in Scotland has been criticised by some women who have suffered complications as a result of the procedure. Two patients sitting on the original review group quit in protest at what they said was a watered-down report. Now independent expert Alison Britton, a professor of healthcare and medical law, will examine the final report.

The report concluded procedures should not be offered routinely to women with pelvic organ prolapse. It recommended patients be offered a range of treatments and given the information to make "informed choices". The report also said reporting of adverse events should be mandatory.

The health secretary, Shona Robison, confirmed the recommendations would continue to be implemented despite calls from campaigners for an all-out ban. The health secretary said the government did not have the power to ban the procedures as that lay with UK regulatory body the Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency.

In other evidence, the chairwoman of the independent review Tracey Gillies apologised for failing to unite all panel members around the review's controversial final report. Ms Gillies took over as chairwoman of the independent review of transvaginal mesh implants in its final stages towards the end of last year. It emerged she had no conversations with previous chairwoman Lesley Wilkie, who resigned for personal reasons.

Her evidence was punctuated by cries of "shame on you" and "rubbish" from a packed public gallery which included some women who had suffered painful and debilitating complications as a result of the procedure. Ms Gillies said her task had been "almost mission impossible from the beginning". She said: "It was clear that there were strongly-held views of difference at the point that I came in, so one could say more fool me for agreeing to chair this.

"This is not something that most people would have ... welcomed would be the wrong word, but it's clearly going to be a very difficult thing and I personally have reflected and feel disappointed that I have not achieved what I would have set out to do, which would have been to bring this in in consensus.

Olive McIlroy and Elaine Holmes - who had both suffered complications as a result of the surgery - quit the review group earlier this year, saying they felt "dismayed and disgusted" at the publication of the independent report. It was claimed that parts of the final report had been removed. Following their resignations, it emerged that a consultant also quit the expert group over concerns about the final draft of the report.

Over the past 20 years, more than 20,000 women in Scotland have had mesh or tape implants but some have suffered painful and debilitating complications. There are more than 400 women currently taking legal action against Scottish health boards and manufacturers as a result of mesh implant surgery.

source: Marcus Morgan Bentley ( born 4 October 1967 ) is a British actor , broadcaster and voice-over artist .
summary: Marcus Morgan Bentley (born 4 October 1967) is a British actor, broadcaster, and voice-over artist. He is best known for his roles in the television series The Inbetweeners, Friday Night Dinner, and Benidorm. He has also appeared in films such as Hot Fuzz, Shaun of the Dead, and The World's End. Bentley is a regular voice-over artist for television commercials and audiobooks. He is also the voice of the character of Mr. Bean in the animated series of the same name.

source: Marcy Smith was woken up by her son David to find their house in Glovertown, Newfoundland and Labrador, completely engulfed in flames. The whole family was able to escape, but their house is destroyed and their dog and cats did not make it. Mrs Smith said if it wasn't for her son, she and her daughter probably wouldn't have survived. David was on FaceTime to his father at the time, so was the only one awake and saw the flames out of the corner of his eye. "Within seconds of him getting us up, the flames were everywhere," Mrs Smith told the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation. "It happened so fast. We were standing in the kitchen by the wood stove and the flames just ate around me and David. The entire kitchen just disappeared while we were standing in it." She said the fire was started by some rubbish she burned in the wood stove, something she had done "a thousand times" before. The fire alarm did not go off. The family had nothing but pyjamas on when they fled, but Mrs Smith said the community has rallied behind them, donating clothes and shoes and even a bike for her son. "All he understands is that me and his sister and him got out. He does not understand that he is the only reason we did," she said. "He did a huge thing for such a young boy. I am so proud of him and I am going to tell him for the rest of his life until he understands what a big thing he did."
summary: Marcy Smith and her family were woken up by their son David, who was on FaceTime with his father, to find their house on fire. The family escaped, but their house and pets were destroyed. The fire was started by rubbish that Mrs. Smith had burned in the wood stove. The fire alarm did not go off. The community has rallied behind the family, donating clothes, shoes, and a bike for David. Mrs. Smith is proud of her son for saving her and her daughter.

source: Margaret Hilda Thatcher , Baroness Thatcher , ( ; 13 October 1925 -- 8 April 2013 ) was a British stateswoman , who served as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom from 1979 to 1990 and as Leader of the Conservative Party from 1975 to 1990 . She was the longest-serving British prime minister of the 20th century , and the first woman to have held the office . In 1975 , Thatcher defeated Heath in the Conservative Party leadership election to become Leader of the Opposition and became the first woman to lead a major political party in the United Kingdom .
summary:
Margaret Thatcher was the first female Prime Minister of the United Kingdom. She served from 1979 to 1990. She was a member of the Conservative Party. She was known for her economic policies, which were called Thatcherism. She was also known for her strong personality and her leadership style.

Thatcher was born in Grantham, Lincolnshire, England, on October 13, 1925. She was the daughter of Alfred Roberts, a grocer, and Beatrice Roberts. She was educated at Kesteven and Grantham Girls' School and Oxford University. She married Denis Thatcher in 1951. They had two children, Mark and Carol.

Thatcher entered politics in 1959, when she was elected to the House of Commons. She served in various government positions, including Minister of Education and Science and Minister of Housing. In 1975, she was elected Leader of the Conservative Party. She became Prime Minister in 1979.

Thatcher's economic policies were based on the idea of free markets and limited government intervention. She cut taxes, reduced government spending, and privatized state-owned industries. She also introduced a tough line on crime and immigration.

Thatcher's policies were controversial, but she was popular with many voters. She was re-elected in 1983 and 1987. However, she was defeated in the 1990 Conservative Party leadership election and resigned as Prime Minister.

Thatcher was a controversial figure, but she was also a significant figure in British history. She was the first female Prime Minister and she had a major impact on British politics and society. She died on April 8, 2013, at the age of 87.

source: Margaret Thatcher . As Prime Minister , she implemented policies that have come to be known as Thatcherism . Always a controversial figure , she has been lauded as one of the greatest and most influential politicians in British history , even as arguments over Thatcherism persist .
summary:
Margaret Thatcher was the first female Prime Minister of the United Kingdom. She served from 1979 to 1990. She was a member of the Conservative Party. Thatcherism is a political philosophy that emphasizes free markets, limited government, and individual responsibility. It is often associated with Thatcher's policies as Prime Minister. Thatcher was a controversial figure, but she is also considered one of the most influential politicians in British history.

Thatcher was born in Grantham, Lincolnshire, in 1925. She was the daughter of a grocer. She studied chemistry at Oxford University. After graduating, she worked as a research chemist. In 1951, she married Denis Thatcher, a businessman. They had two children.

Thatcher entered politics in the 1950s. She was elected to Parliament in 1959. She served in various ministerial positions in the Conservative government of the 1960s and 1970s. In 1975, she was elected leader of the Conservative Party.

Thatcher became Prime Minister in 1979. She was the first woman to hold that office. She served for 11 years. During her time as Prime Minister, Thatcher implemented a number of policies that have come to be known as Thatcherism. These policies included privatizing state-owned industries, reducing government spending, and cutting taxes.

Thatcher was a controversial figure. She was often criticized for her policies, which were seen as being too harsh. However, she was also praised for her strong leadership and her ability to get things done. Thatcher is considered one of the most influential politicians in British history. She is credited with transforming the British economy and with restoring Britain's place in the world.

source: Marnie is a 1964 American psychological thriller film directed by Alfred Hitchcock .
summary:
Marnie is a 1964 American psychological thriller film directed and produced by Alfred Hitchcock, and written by Jay Presson Allen. It stars Tippi Hedren, Sean Connery, Diane Baker, and Martin Balsam. The film is about a young woman with a mysterious past who becomes involved with a wealthy businessman.

Marnie is a complex and disturbing film that explores themes of identity, sexuality, and violence. It is considered one of Hitchcock's best films, and Hedren's performance is particularly acclaimed.

The film opens with Marnie (Tippi Hedren) robbing a bank. She is caught and arrested, but she is released when her employer, Mark Rutland (Sean Connery), bails her out. Mark is a wealthy businessman who is attracted to Marnie, and he proposes to her. Marnie accepts, and they are married.

After their wedding, Mark takes Marnie to his home in Bodega Bay, California. Marnie is initially happy in her new life, but she soon begins to have nightmares about her childhood. She also becomes increasingly withdrawn and secretive.

One day, Mark discovers that Marnie has been stealing money from him. He confronts her, and she confesses that she has been stealing since she was a child. She tells him that she is afraid of red, and that she has a recurring nightmare about a man who is trying to kill her.

Mark is determined to help Marnie, and he takes her to see a psychiatrist. The psychiatrist tells Mark that Marnie's fear of red is a symbol of her fear of sex. He also tells Mark that Marnie was abused as a child by her father.

Mark is shocked by this revelation, but he is determined to help Marnie. He takes her to see her father, and he confronts him about the abuse. Marnie's father denies the abuse, but Mark is convinced that he is lying.

Mark and Marnie eventually confront Marnie's father, and he confesses to the abuse. Marnie is finally able to confront her fears, and she begins to heal.

Marnie is a powerful and disturbing film that explores the themes of identity, sexuality, and violence. It is considered one of Hitchcock's best films, and Hedren's performance is particularly acclaimed.

source: Martin Van Buren ( Maarten van Buren ; December 5 , 1782 -- July 24 , 1862 ) was an American politician who served as the eighth President of the United States ( 1837 -- 41 ) . A member of the Democratic Party , he served in a number of other senior roles , including eighth Vice President ( 1833 -- 37 ) and tenth Secretary of State ( 1829 -- 31 ) , both under Andrew Jackson . Van Buren was a major supporter and organizer for Jackson in the 1828 election , and ran for Governor of New York in the hope of using his personal popularity to boost Jackson 's campaign . Jackson and Van Buren were elected , and after serving as governor for two months , Van Buren resigned to become Jackson 's Secretary of State . In 1831 , following his resignation as Secretary of State , which aided Jackson in resolving the Petticoat affair , Jackson gave Van Buren a recess appointment as American minister to Britain .
summary:
Martin Van Buren was the eighth president of the United States. He served from 1837 to 1841. He was a member of the Democratic Party. He was born in Kinderhook, New York, on December 5, 1782. He died in Kinderhook on July 24, 1862.

Van Buren was a lawyer and politician. He served in the New York State Senate from 1812 to 1820. He was the governor of New York from 1829 to 1832. He was the vice president of the United States from 1833 to 1837. He was the president of the United States from 1837 to 1841.

Van Buren was a strong supporter of Andrew Jackson. He was known as the "Little Magician" because of his political skills. He was the first president to be born in the United States after the American Revolution. He was the first president to be born in New York. He was the first president to be a member of the Democratic Party.

Van Buren's presidency was marked by the Panic of 1837. The Panic of 1837 was a financial crisis that caused a severe recession. Van Buren's response to the Panic of 1837 was not popular. He was defeated for re-election in 1840 by William Henry Harrison.

After his presidency, Van Buren served as the United States minister to Great Britain from 1831 to 1832. He also served as the United States minister to the Netherlands from 1839 to 1841. He was the United States minister to France from 1842 to 1845.

Van Buren was a controversial figure. He was a strong supporter of slavery. He was also a strong supporter of states' rights. He was opposed to the expansion of the United States into new territories.

Van Buren was a complex and fascinating figure. He was a skilled politician who played a major role in the development of the Democratic Party. He was also a controversial figure who was opposed to the expansion of the United States and the abolition of slavery.

After George 's death in 1936 , she became queen mother when her eldest son , Edward , ascended the throne , but to her dismay , he abdicated later the same year in order to marry twice-divorced American socialite Wallis Simpson . She supported her second son , Albert , who succeeded to the throne as George VI , until his death in 1952 . She died the following year , during the reign of her granddaughter Queen Elizabeth II , who had not yet been crowned .
summary:
Mary of Teck was the Queen consort of the United Kingdom and the Dominions of the British Commonwealth from 1910 until her death in 1953. She was the wife of King George V and the mother of King Edward VIII, King George VI, and Queen Elizabeth II.

Mary was born in 1867 in London, the daughter of Francis, Duke of Teck, and Princess Mary Adelaide of Cambridge. She was educated privately and showed an early interest in music and art. In 1893, she married Prince Albert Victor, Duke of Clarence, the eldest son of King Edward VII and Queen Alexandra. Albert Victor died suddenly in 1892, and Mary became a widow at the age of 25.

In 1901, Mary's brother-in-law, King Edward VII, died, and her husband's younger brother, George, ascended the throne as King George V. Mary became queen consort, and she played an active role in public life. She was involved in a number of charities and organizations, and she also supported her husband in his duties as king.

After George V's death in 1936, Mary's eldest son, Edward VIII, ascended the throne. However, Edward abdicated the throne later that year in order to marry twice-divorced American socialite Wallis Simpson. Mary's second son, Albert, succeeded to the throne as King George VI. Mary supported her son during his reign, and she was a popular figure with the British public.

Mary died in 1953, at the age of 85. She was succeeded by her granddaughter, Queen Elizabeth II.

source: Matching Models in London describes itself as "an international temp agency for beautiful and talented people". It advertised for a personal assistant with "a classic look, brown long hair with b-c cup". The Equality and Human Rights Commission (EHRC) called it "appalling, unlawful and demeaning to women". Rebecca Hilsenrath, chief executive of the EHRC, said it would be writing to Matching Models "asking for them to clarify their hiring practices immediately". Meanwhile, women's equality campaigners said its ads were "straight out of the 1970s". Sam Smethers, chief executive of the Fawcett Society, said: "It is extraordinary that they are taking this approach and almost certainly falls foul of equality legislation. "If we ever wonder why the battle for gender equality hasn't been won, this is a timely reminder." The agency's founder Nathalie Jansen said: "Our clients are important to us - and looks are important." Another job advert on the agency's website asks a "sexy female driver" to drive a Porsche Cayenne two days a week for between £40,000 and £50,000-a-year for a Knightsbridge-based businessman and polo team owner. Employment lawyer James Lynas, partner at Winckworth Sherwood, said the advert was "clearly unlawful", adding anyone could complain to the Equality and Human Rights Commission, who have powers to intervene. He said an employment tribunal could find the use of phrases such as "beautiful and attractive" were really code for "young", and in reality discriminatory against older women. He added: "A male driver who genuinely wanted the job could submit an application and sue for sex discrimination if rejected. Compensation for such claims is unlimited. " A statement on the agency's website states: "It is almost politically incorrect to request someone to work for you that is both attractive as well as professionally equipped with the right set of skills. "However, our company understands the importance of having the right people representing your company, because after all, first impressions count." But Ms Hilsenrath said: "Matching Models are right about one thing; first impressions count, but the important stuff is not about your hair colour. "If they wish to maintain their reputation, they should act like a business in the 21st Century and consign this type of sexism to the history books." Under the 2010 Equality Act, it is against the law to say, or imply, that you will discriminate against anyone - including saying that you are unable to cater for disabled workers. Employers are also not allowed to question a candidate's age, sexual orientation, marital status, number of children or plans to have children, disability, race or religion. As for specifying clothing sizes, an employer has to be able to show that it is essential to the nature or context of the work. Talking about the personal assistant advert, Ms Jansen said: "The client who wants the specific cup size is an older gentleman - he has a specific outfit he designed with Christian Dior. He wants a "Jackie O" look. And he wants a lady with a smaller cup size to fit into the outfit." "I recently had an Indian businessman who interviewed 60 women from my firm. He wanted a blonde, blue eyed, Greek woman. He hired 6 of them to work on his plane." Matching Models clients include MTV, Louis Vuitton, Coca-Cola, the Renualt Formula 1 team and Harrods. Ms Jansen said she had hired 5,000 people worldwide and pointed out MTV wanted models with tattoos and piercings.
summary:
Matching Models, a London-based temp agency, has been criticized for its job adverts, which have been described as "appalling", "unlawful" and "demeaning to women". The agency's adverts have specified requirements such as "a classic look, brown long hair with b-c cup" and "a sexy female driver". The Equality and Human Rights Commission (EHRC) has said it will be writing to the agency "asking for them to clarify their hiring practices immediately".

The agency's founder, Nathalie Jansen, has defended the adverts, saying that "our clients are important to us - and looks are important". She has also said that the agency has hired 5,000 people worldwide, including models with tattoos and piercings.

The EHRC's chief executive, Rebecca Hilsenrath, said the adverts were "appalling, unlawful and demeaning to women". She said: "It is extraordinary that they are taking this approach and almost certainly falls foul of equality legislation. "If we ever wonder why the battle for gender equality hasn't been won, this is a timely reminder."

Women's equality campaigners have also condemned the adverts. "If we ever wonder why the battle for gender equality hasn't been won, this is a timely reminder."

A statement on the agency's website states: "It is almost politically incorrect to request someone to work for you that is both attractive as well as professionally equipped with the right set of skills. "However, our company understands the importance of having the right people representing your company, because after all, first impressions count."

But Ms Hilsenrath said: "Matching Models are right about one thing; first impressions count, but the important stuff is not about your hair colour. "If they wish to maintain their reputation, they should act like a business in the 21st Century and consign this type of sexism to the history books."

Talking about the personal assistant advert, Ms Jansen said: "The client who wants the specific cup size is an older gentleman - he has a specific outfit he designed with Christian Dior. He wants a "Jackie O" look. And he wants a lady with a smaller cup size to fit into the outfit."

"I recently had an Indian businessman who interviewed 60 women from my firm. He wanted a blonde, blue eyed, Greek woman. He hired 6 of them to work on his plane."

source: Matteo Renzi ( [ matˈtɛːo ˈrɛntsi ] ; born 11 January 1975 ) is an Italian politician who served as the Prime Minister of Italy from February 2014 until December 2016 .
summary: Matteo Renzi is an Italian politician who served as the Prime Minister of Italy from February 2014 until December 2016. He was born on 11 January 1975 in Florence, Italy. He is a member of the Democratic Party (PD) and served as the party's secretary from 2013 to 2017. Renzi was elected Prime Minister in 2014 after defeating incumbent Enrico Letta in a leadership contest. He resigned in 2016 after failing to win a referendum on constitutional reform. Renzi is a controversial figure in Italian politics. He has been praised for his economic reforms and for his efforts to modernize Italy. However, he has also been criticized for his arrogance and for his handling of the migrant crisis.

source: Matthew David McConaughey ( [ məˈkɒnəheɪ ] born November 4 , 1969 ) is an American actor . Since 2011 he has preferred dramatic roles , in such films as The Lincoln Lawyer ( 2011 ) , Bernie ( 2011 ) , Killer Joe ( 2011 ) , The Paperboy ( 2012 ) , Mud ( 2012 ) , Magic Mike ( 2012 ) , The Wolf of Wall Street ( 2013 ) , Dallas Buyers Club ( 2013 ) , Interstellar ( 2014 ) , The Sea of Trees , and Free State of Jones ( both 2016 ) . Mud (2012 film) . The film stars Matthew McConaughey , Tye Sheridan , Jacob Lofland , Sam Shepard , and Reese Witherspoon .
summary: Matthew McConaughey is an American actor who has starred in a variety of films, including The Lincoln Lawyer, Bernie, Killer Joe, The Paperboy, Mud, Magic Mike, The Wolf of Wall Street, Dallas Buyers Club, Interstellar, The Sea of Trees, and Free State of Jones. He was born on November 4, 1969, in Uvalde, Texas. He began his acting career in the early 1990s, appearing in small roles in films such as Dazed and Confused and A Time to Kill. He had his breakthrough role in the 1996 film A Time to Kill, for which he was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor. He has since starred in a number of successful films, including The Wedding Planner, How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days, Failure to Launch, and Ghosts of Girlfriends Past. In 2011, he began to focus on more dramatic roles, starring in films such as The Lincoln Lawyer, Bernie, Killer Joe, The Paperboy, Mud, Magic Mike, The Wolf of Wall Street, Dallas Buyers Club, Interstellar, The Sea of Trees, and Free State of Jones. He won an Academy Award for Best Actor for his performance in Dallas Buyers Club. He is married to Camila Alves and they have three children together.

source: Maurice Harold Macmillan , 1st Earl of Stockton , ( 10 February 1894 -- 29 December 1986 ) was a British Conservative politician and statesman who served as the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom from 10 January 1957 to 19 October 1963 .
summary: Harold Macmillan was a British Conservative politician and statesman who served as the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom from 1957 to 1963. He was born in London on February 10, 1894, and educated at Eton and Balliol College, Oxford. He served in the Grenadier Guards during World War I and was wounded at the Battle of Loos. After the war, he entered politics and was elected to Parliament in 1924. He held a number of ministerial posts in the Conservative governments of the 1930s and 1940s, including Secretary of State for Housing and Local Government, Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs, and Chancellor of the Exchequer. In 1957, he became Prime Minister after the resignation of Anthony Eden. He is best known for his handling of the Suez Crisis in 1956, his attempts to modernize the Conservative Party, and his role in the decolonization of Africa. He retired as Prime Minister in 1963 and was created Earl of Stockton in 1984. He died on December 29, 1986.

summary: Morton beat Alloa 3-1 in a Scottish League One match on Saturday. source: Media playback is not supported on this device Benteke becomes the Reds' second most expensive signing, on what the club describe as a "long-term contract". Liverpool, who last week sold forward Raheem Sterling to Manchester City for £49m, triggered a release clause in Benteke's contract to make the 24-year-old their seventh summer signing. Belgium international Benteke scored 49 goals in 101 games for Villa after signing from Genk for £7m in 2012. He told the Liverpool website: "I'm very happy to be here. I came here to win trophies. I came here to reach some great goals with the team. "It was the right club for me because I had a good chat with the manager and I wanted to be part of his project." Liverpool struggled for goals last season following the £75m sale of Luis Suarez to Barcelona and prolonged injury absences for England international Daniel Sturridge as they finished sixth in the Premier League. Signings Mario Balotelli and Rickie Lambert produced three league goals and, after acknowledging the lack of scoring last season, manager Brendan Rodgers has added Benteke to revive the Reds' attack. Liverpool have also signed forwards Danny Ings from Burnley and Brazil international Roberto Firmino from Hoffenheim, while Benteke's international team-mate Divock Origi has returned to the club after spending last season on loan at Lille. Benteke missed the 2014 World Cup in Brazil with an Achilles tendon injury but returned to action last October and scored 15 times to help Villa stay in the Premier League and reach the FA Cup final. Former Villa manager Paul Lambert, who brought Benteke into English football, believes he will do well at Anfield. Lambert told BBC Sport: "He's a brilliant number nine. He won't need just crosses to come into the box. If he gets the service he'll get goals. "That's the type of guy he is and on his game he's a handful. I'm delighted for him. He's earned that move and if he can do what I think he can do, he'll do great for them. "He's going to have to handle the expectancy level of winning [at Liverpool]. When you speak to Christian, he has a great belief in himself to do well." Former Liverpool striker John Aldridge is also excited to see Benteke lead the Liverpool forward line, telling BBC Radio 5 live: "He gives something different, a massive presence up front. "It's a fallacy when people say he doesn't play the Liverpool way. He knocked Liverpool out of the semi-final of the FA Cup when he played through the middle. "He's very quick, very strong, very aggressive and that's something we haven't had for some time up front. It's something I'm really happy with and I think he'll bring a lot to the squad. "I'm a lot more optimistic than I was this time last year. The strikers only scored eight goals last year, we can only do better than that going forward." Find all the latest football transfers on our dedicated page.
summary: Liverpool have signed Aston Villa striker Christian Benteke for £32.5m. The 24-year-old Belgium international has signed a long-term contract with the Reds. Benteke is Liverpool's second most expensive signing, after Luis Suarez's £75m move to Barcelona in 2014. He is also the first player to join Liverpool since Raheem Sterling's £49m move to Manchester City last week. Benteke scored 49 goals in 101 appearances for Villa after joining the club from Genk in 2012. He was named the club's player of the year in 2013-14. Benteke is a powerful and athletic striker who is good in the air. He is also a good finisher and has the ability to score goals from long range. Benteke's arrival is a major boost for Liverpool, who struggled for goals last season. The Reds finished sixth in the Premier League, scoring just 49 goals. Benteke is expected to partner Daniel Sturridge up front for Liverpool. Sturridge has scored 40 goals in 89 appearances for the club. Benteke's arrival is also a sign of Liverpool's ambition. The Reds are looking to challenge for the Premier League title and the Champions League. Benteke's signing is a statement of intent from Liverpool.
